intro: Thlaspi latifolium, commonly known as broadleaf pennycress, is a flowering plant native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes other well-known plants such as mustard and cabbage. The plant typically grows in moist, disturbed soils and can be found in meadows, roadsides, and agricultural fields. Its leaves are broad and lobed, and it produces small, yellow flowers in clusters. The seeds are enclosed in a siliqua, a type of dry fruit characteristic of the Brassicaceae family.
